item.title: Simona Halep sets up French Open semi-final clash with Garbine Muguruza after hard-earned three set victory over Angelique Kerber
item.description: World No 1 Simona Halep won a bruising quarter-final battle against Germany's Angelique Kerber 6-7, 6-3, 6-2 to book a place against Garbine Muguruza in the French Open semis.
item.content:encoded:
World No 1 Simona Halep won a bruising quarter-final battle against Germany's Angelique Kerber 6-7, 6-3, 6-2 to book a place against Garbine Muguruza in the French Open semis.

Halep started slowly, spraying shots wide as she lost the first four games of the match against the No 12 seed who hit her early ground strokes with lethal accuracy.

However the Romanian clawed her way back into the contest, winning three straight games as both players struggled to hold on to their serves in a monster opening set that swung one way and then the next.


Kerber eventually prevailed in a tiebreak, but Halep came out all guns blazing in the second, firing baseline bullets at her opponent, who tried to cling on against the onslaught. By the third set Halep had broken down the German's defences -- and her resolve.

'It's always a tough match when I play against her. After the first set I just stayed strong and didn't give up,' Halep told the crowd in a post-match interview.

'I missed a lot in the beginning. I tried to do too much. I changed the tactics a bit and it worked.'

item.title: Everton goalkeeper Joel Robles in talks to join Spanish side Getafe
item.description: Everton goalkeeper Joel Robles is in talks to join Spanish side Getafe. Robles is being lined up to replace Vicente Guaita who is expected to sign for Crystal Palace.
item.content:encoded:
Everton goalkeeper Joel Robles is in talks to join Spanish side Getafe.

Robles is being lined up to replace Vicente Guaita who is expected to sign for Crystal Palace.

Getafe are poised to sign Robles on a free transfer, with his contract at Everton set to expire at the end of this month.


The 27-year-old Robles was signed for Everton by Roberto Martinez who had brought him to England while at Wigan Athletic.

Robles wants regular first team football after being marginalised by the arrival of England's expected number one for the World Cup Jordan Pickford.  

JOEL ROBLES' CAREER 

2009-2013: Atletico Madrid

2012: Rayo Vallecano (loan)

2013: Wigan (loan)

2013-present: Everton

Last season Robles didn't feature at all in the Premier League for Everton and was restricted to just two appearances in the Europa League.

An Everton player since 2013, when he joined from Wigan, Robles has played 65 times for the Toffees in total.

In addition to Pickford, Everton are also able to call upon experienced goalkeeper Maarten Stekelenburg.

item.title: Leicester trigger £3million release clause in Jonny Evans' contract and could finalise deal to sign defender from West Brom this week
item.description: Leicester have triggered the £3m release clause in Jonny Evans's contract and a move could be completed this week. Sportsmail reported that Leicester were working hard on signing Evans.
item.content:encoded:
Leicester have triggered the £3m release clause in Jonny Evans's contract and a move could be completed this week.

Sportsmail reported on May 18 that Leicester were working hard on signing the West Bromwich Albion defender but a £4m agent's fee was proving prohibitive.

Negotiations over that additional sum have now progressed to the point where Leicester have contacted West Brom to make the formal bid that, according to terms, must be accepted.


Leicester have tried to sign Evans, 30, for the last three transfer windows and saw a £23m offer rejected last summer.

The club now finally look to be closing in on their long-term target, with a deal understood to be worth £100,000 per week on the table for the Northern Ireland international. 

JONNY EVANS' CAREER 

2006-2015: Manchester United

2006: Royal Antwerp (loan)

2006-2007: Sunderland (loan)

2008: Sunderland (loan)

2015-present: West Brom 

Evans had attracted interest from Manchester City and Arsenal and was waiting to see if either side would return this summer, but each is looking at different options.

Leicester want to partner Evans with Harry Maguire at the heart of defence. Evans should become Claude Puel's second transfer of the window after Porto right-back Ricardo Pereira joined for £22m.

item.title: 'Do you want some?': Wealdstone Raider interrupts Tyson Fury press conference and 'calls out' heavyweight boxer as he prepares to make comeback against Sefer Seferi
item.description: The build-up to Tyson Fury's comeback fight descended to new levels of weirdness and farce on Wednesday as a press conference was interrupted by an internet joke from 2013.
item.content:encoded:
The build-up to Tyson Fury's comeback fight descended to new levels of weirdness and farce on Wednesday as a press conference was interrupted by an internet joke from 2013.

After two years out of the ring due to fitness problems and a back-dated drugs ban, Fury will fight again on Saturday night in a heavyweight clash at Manchester Arena against Sefer Seferi. 

As is typical with the outspoken and often controversial Fury, the build-up has been unusual - and was topped when the Wealdstone Raider called the boxer out.

Scroll down for video. 


The Wealdstone Raider, aka Gordon Hill, gained notoriety five years ago when a clip of him taunting opposition fans at a Wealdstone FC match went viral. 

He burst into the press conference in some seemingly staged drama on Wednesday, shouting his catchphrase 'Do you want some?'. 

The diminutive Raider then offered to fight man-mountain Fury, shouting: 'I'll give it to you. Do you think you can deal with me?'

Fury played along, saying 'definitely not' and pointing at Seferi, saying 'get him instead'. Seferi then jokingly called for security. 

The Raider then offered a final blast, shouting: 'I'll see you Saturday. You'll find out who I am Saturday. Saturday night, after him, I'll have you', before leaving with a smirk.

Fury meanwhile was at his bombastic best at the press conference, describing himself as 'a goldfish trapped who is now being released back into the river where I belong.'

He said: 'Just put me back in and watch me swim, I'm an effective swimmer. I'm looking good. I'm flying. I feel good. I don't remember feeling any better. I just want it more. The Mac is back.

'I fell out of love with boxing. I was married to the game for too long, so I spiced it up and put some lingerie on her!'

DO YOU WANT SOME TYSON?!?

Wealdstone Raider interrupts press conference and calls out @Tyson_Fury!! 😲😲😲@DoYouWantSome_ pic.twitter.com/IPWl2Bx3Dj

— Frank Warren (@frankwarren_tv) June 6, 2018

item.title: Manchester United defender Chris Smalling plays 'badminton football' on the streets of Vietnam during holiday
item.description: Chris Smalling wasn't included in England's squad for the World Cup this summer, but the Manchester United defender is certainly making the most of his time off.
item.content:encoded:
Chris Smalling wasn't included in England's squad for the World Cup this summer, but the Manchester United defender is certainly making the most of his time off.

Smalling is currently on holiday in Asia with his wife Samantha, and, after taking in the sights in Thailand, the centre-back has now moved on to Vietnam.

The 28-year-old took the time to play a tricky game of 'badminton football' with the locals, showcasing impressive close control. 


Next Stop 🇻🇳 street game with the locals 😄 #hanoi #vietnam

A post shared by Chris Smalling (@smalling) on Jun 6, 2018 at 6:54am PDT

Some kinda badminton football street game popular in Hanoi 🤷🏼‍♀️ #hanoi #vietnam #smallingadventure

A post shared by Sam Smalling (@samsmallinginsta) on Jun 6, 2018 at 7:05am PDT

 

During his holiday Smalling has been very busy - while in Thailand he enjoyed Muai Thai boxing, a cookery class and quad biking. 

Smalling is now enjoying his time in Vietnam and was watched by several onlookers as he played the game.

Getting back into the England setup could prove problematic for Smalling as long as Gareth Southgate remains in charge, while there is also much competition for places at the heart of the Manchester United defence, with manager Jose Mourinho also able to call upon the likes of Eric Bailly, Phil Jones, Victor Lindelof and Marcos Rojo.

After enjoying his time off, Smalling will return to United for pre-season training next month and will be determined to make a major impact.

United are still looking to win the Premier League for the first time since Sir Alex Ferguson retired in 2013 and know that they will face a major challenge to end that wait next season given the quality that Manchester City possess.

item.title: Liverpool appoint Philipp Jacobsen as medical rehabilitation and performance manager as they continue to reshape backroom team
item.description: Jacobsen joins from the Qatar-based Aspetar facility, which specialises in sports medicine and rehabilitation, where he was a senior physiotherapist, but he now moves to Melwood.
item.content:encoded:
Liverpool have strengthened their backroom team by appointing Philipp Jacobsen as medical rehabilitation and performance manager.

Jacobsen joins from the Qatar-based Aspetar facility, which specialises in sports medicine and rehabilitation, where he was a senior physiotherapist. He will jointly work alongside Dr Andrew Massey at Melwood.

He has previously worked with the Qatar national team and Panathinaikos, and recently accompanied Reds midfielder Adam Lallana on his rehabilitation trip to South Africa.

Liverpool currently have three players in Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (knee), Joe Gomez (ankle) and Joel Matip (thigh) all recovering from surgery which prematurely ended their seasons.

Work continues apace off the field with Liverpool announcing four friendlies against fellow north-west clubs before they head to the United States for the International Champions Cup.

Jurgen Klopp's side travel to Chester on July 7 before heading to Tranmere the following Wednesday with further trips to Bury (July 14) and Blackburn (July 19).

After their friendly at Ewood Park, Liverpool fly to America for matches against Borussia Dortmund in Charlotte, North Carolina, Manchester City in New Jersey and Manchester United in Detroit before returning for their final preparation game against Napoli at Dublin's Aviva Stadium on August 4.

item.title: Soccer Aid 2018 teams: Robbie Williams and Usain Bolt lineups revealed
item.description: Soccer Aid 2018 is under a week away and the lineups for the big biennial charity match have been released. The match will be played in an England v World XI set up. Here are the teams.
item.content:encoded:
Soccer Aid 2018 is under a week away and the lineups for the big match have been released.

The biennial charity event that pits celebrities and football stars against each other in the name of charity has raised over £24 million since its inception ten years ago.

One of the charity’s co-founders and Unicef UK Ambassador, pop star Robbie Williams, returns as the captain of England, while the fastest man alive, Olympic gold-medallist Usain Bolt will lead the line of the Rest of the World team.

The match will be played in an England v World XI set up.

Soccer Aid 2018 teams

The Soccer Aid 2018 teams boast a range of former footballing and showbiz superstars. 

Olympic legends Sir Mo Farah and Usain Bolt will go head-to-head, while former Manchester United stars Michael Owen, Edwin van der Sar, Phil Neville and Eric Cantona will all return to the Theatre of Dreams.  

A game like no other, #SoccerAid 2018. ⚽️
Sunday 6.30pm @ITV @SoccerAid @Unicef_UK pic.twitter.com/sP7EZVHJ4z

— ITV (@ITV) June 5, 2018

Other international superstars include former Barcelona and Holland star Patrick Kluivert, Dutch legend Clarence Seedorf, former Manchester City player Yaya Toure and Arsenal Invincibles player Robert Pires. 

Avid Liverpool fan, Damian Lewis will play alongside former Liverpool player Danny Murphy, while comedian Lee Mack said he will bring 'unrivalled physical prowess, unbelievable abilities, and movie star good looks' to the team.

When is Soccer Aid 2018?

In 5 days we walk out in front of 75,000 people to play the Slightly-less-beautiful-version-of-the-Beautiful Game and raise millions for thousands of poor, undernourished children around the world with @socceraid. Please bung in a tenner if you can. pic.twitter.com/nlMMqikIqD

How to get Soccer Aid 2018 tickets

Tickets for Soccer Aid 2018 are still available to buy on the Manchester United website.

item.title: 'I've told my family I don't want them going out there because of racism': England star Danny Rose makes tough call ahead of World Cup in Russia
item.description: There are widespread concerns surrounding racism on the eve of the World Cup, with the Russian Football Union fined £22,000 by FIFA for racist chanting in a March friendly against France.
item.content:encoded:
England left back Danny Rose has told his family not to travel to Russia for the World Cup over fears of racial abuse.

The 27-year-old Tottenham defender will jet off with the rest of the Three Lions ahead of the tournament but has asked his loved ones to remain behind.

There are widespread concerns surrounding racism on the eve of the World Cup, with the Russian Football Union fined £22,000 by FIFA for racist chanting in a March friendly against France in St Petersburg.

England boss Gareth Southgate says protocols are in place if anything flares up during matches, but Rose has made the difficult call of asking his family not to head to Russia to cheer him on.

'I've told my family I don't want them going out there because of racism and anything else that may happen,' he told the London Evening Standard.

'I don't want to be worrying, when I'm trying to prepare for games, for my family's safety.


'If anything happens to me, it wouldn't affect me like it would if my family had been abused.

'I'm fine with whatever may or may not happen, and I like to think I'll be able to deal with it in the right way.

'My dad's really upset. I could hear it in his voice. He said he may never get a chance again to come and watch me in a World Cup.

'That was emotional, hearing that. It's really sad. It's just how it is. Somehow Russia got the World Cup and we have to get on with it.'

Rose has reason to be suspicious when it comes to the punishments dished out for racism.

He was sent off after the final whistle of an under-21 clash with Serbia in 2012 after suffering racial abuse and reacting at the end of the match.

'I have no faith in the justice system so I don't let anything affect me,' he added.

'I didn't get any support after Serbia. I never had a conversation with anybody outside of England.'

item.title: Perfect day to end a drought! Freddy Adu nets first goal in THREE YEARS for Las Vegas Lights on his 29th birthday
item.description: American attacking midfielder Freddy Adu netted his first goal in THREE YEARS playing for the Las Vegas Lights on Saturday - a day that also turned out to be his 29th birthday.
item.content:encoded:
Freddy Adu will be a familiar name to the dedicated Championship manager players but even they will find themselves surprised by his latest triumph.

The attacking midfielder ended his three-year goal drought on Saturday on what was his 29th birthday.

Formerly of Benfica, Monaco and DC United, Adu, now playing for the Las Vegas Lights, sent a packed stadium wild with a rare goal to end his long wait on a perfect day. 


Lights brushed aside Colorado Springs Switchbacks 4-1 with Adu netting the home side's second goal minutes into the second half. 

Carlos Alvarez, Sammy Ochoa and Matt Thomas got the other goals in what turned out to be a resounding win.

The American forward was rewarded with the 'hardest working man of the match' award for Saturday's performance and along with the rest of his team-mates received a $100 poker chip (£74). 

Adu was seen as the 'next Pele' at just 14 but never kicked on and has gone to reveal the weight of expectation weighed heavy as his career floundered.

The Lights are Adu's 14th club as a senior professional having made his debut for the US national team aged 16. 

Las Vegas Lights are now 10 months into their existence and like Adu are devleoping all the time.

Thye have taken a novel approach to football so far having partnered with a nearby cannabis dispensary and installed a DJ in the home dressing room before matches.

item.title: Liverpool have announced four more pre-season friendlies – which start before the World Cup even finishes!
item.description: Liverpool have announced four more pre-season friendlies, with some of the games taking place before the World Cup even finishes.
item.content:encoded:
Liverpool have announced four more pre-season friendlies, with some of the games taking place before the World Cup even finishes.

The Reds will play four games in England, starting with a trip to take on National League North side Chester on July 7.

Then on July 11, four days before the World Cup final, Jurgen Klopp's team will be in action again as they make the short trip to play newly-promoted League Two outfit Tranmere Rovers.


A further away game is scheduled for July 14, when Liverpool will play another League Two team, Bury.

Following that Liverpool face Championship side Blackburn Rovers on July 19.

Liverpool had previously announced that they will play four more games against considerably more high-profile opponents.

As part of the International Champions Cup, Liverpool will play games in the United States against Borussia Dortmund, Manchester City and Manchester United on July 22, 25 and 28 respectively.

LIVERPOOL'S PRE-SEASON SCHEDULE 

July 7 - Chester (away) - 3pm

July 11 - Tranmere (away) - 7.30pm

July 14 - Bury (away) - 3pm

July 19 - Blackburn (away) - 7.45pm

July 22 - Borussia Dortmund (netural) 

July 25 - Manchester CIty (neutral)

July 28 - Manchester United (neutral)

August 4 - Napoli (away)  

Liverpool will then conclude their preparations for the new campaign on August 4 when they travel to Italy to play Napoli away.

Klopp will be without a host of players for the start of the pre-season programme, with seven Liverpool stars at the World Cup, including Mohamed Salah and Roberto Firmino.

Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain and Joe Gomez are both out injured, but Klopp will still be able to call upon the likes of Virgil Van Dijk, Nathaniel Clyne, James Milner, Georginio Wijnaldum and Adam Lallana for the early friendlies along with new signings Naby Keita and Fabinho.

item.title: Garbine Muguruza beats Maria Sharapova in straight sets to reach the French Open semi-finals
item.description: MIKE DICKSON IN PARIS: Maria Sharapova’s return to the French Open ended in a crushing defeat when Garbine Muguruza emphatically silenced the shrieking Russian at Roland Garros.
item.content:encoded:
Maria Sharapova’s return to the French Open ended in a crushing defeat when Garbine Muguruza emphatically silenced the shrieking Russian at Roland Garros.

Wimbledon champion Muguruza took just 70 minutes to brush her aside 6-2, 6-1 and make the semi-finals at what is looking like one of the fortnights when she runs hot.

Serena Williams might have fancied meeting this version of Sharapova, who made six double faults and 27 unforced errors. The Spaniard was awaiting the winner of Simona Halep and Angelique Kerber. 


Being ushered into the last eight by the last minute withdrawal of Williams was not necessarily any help to the world No 30, who would have sapped plenty of emotional energy building up to the much-hyped clash.

If the whole of Roland Garros was deflated by Williams’s non-appearance then it appeared that may have been the case with the Russian, who started very sluggishly.

She sent down three double faults to be broken at the very start and then, after a marathon third game, found herself 3-0 down with the Spaniard finding a deep and consistent length.

By the time Sharapova recovered somewhat to play better it was too late, and Muguruza was into her impressive stride, with the court finally filling up post-lunch.

Early breaks were exchanged in the second set but it was complete one-way traffic after that, with the promise of the Russian’s clay court campaign quickly extinguished.
item.dc:abstract: MIKE DICKSON IN PARIS: Maria Sharapova’s return to the French Open ended in a crushing defeat when Garbine Muguruza emphatically silenced the shrieking Russian at Roland Garros. Wimbledon champion Muguruza took just 70 minutes to brush her aside 6-2, 6-1 and make the semi-finals at what is looking like one of the fortnights when she runs hot. Serena Williams might have fancied meeting this version of Sharapova, who made six double faults and 27 unforced errors. The Spaniard was awaiting the winner of Simona Halep and Angelique Kerber.

item.title: Man United sign Diogo Dalot for £17.4m on five-year deal from Porto as Jose Mourinho says 'In his age group, he's the best full back in Europe'
item.description: The Portugal Under 21 international has joined the club for £17.4million. United wanted a right back to compete with Antonio Valencia, who is 33 and needs constant treatment on a knee injury.
item.content:encoded:
Manchester United have completed the signing of full back Diogo Dalot from Porto on a five-year deal.

The Portugal Under 21 international has joined the club for £17.4million and has the option to stay an extra year in his contract. 

United wanted a right back to compete with Antonio Valencia, who is 33 and needs constant treatment on a knee injury. 

👋 A big #MUFC welcome to @DalotDiogo!#BemvindoDalot 🇵🇹 pic.twitter.com/kYPAfmdapk

— Manchester United (@ManUtd) June 6, 2018

The 19-year-old can also play left back. He broke into Porto's first team in February in that position and played in his club's 0-0 Champions League draw at Liverpool.

He helped Portugal win the 2016 UEFA European Under 17 Championship, scoring twice in five games in Azerbaijan including once in the final against Spain. 

On signing the teenager, United manager Jose Mourinho told the club's official website : 'Diogo is an extremely talented young defender with all the qualities to quickly become a great player for this club. 

DIOGO DALOT'S 2017-18 STATS FOR PORTO

Appearances: 33

Goals: 4

Assists: 8

Yellow cards: 3

Red cards: 1

'He has all the attributes that a full back needs: physicality, tactical intelligence and technical quality, combined with a Porto Academy mentality which prepares players for the maturity they need at the professional level. 

'In his age group, he is the best full back in Europe and we all believe he has a bright future ahead of him at Manchester United.' 

Dalot joins Brazilian midfielder Fred, who became United's first summer signing on Tuesday, at the club. 

Dalot said: 'Joining Manchester United is an unbelievable opportunity for me. 

'I have grown up in Porto's Academy and I am so thankful for everything they have done for me. 

'But the chance of coming to the biggest club in the world is something I just couldn't turn down. 

'I'm excited about working with Jose Mourinho and learning everything I can from such a successful coach.

'I am looking forward to playing alongside the fantastic players in the squad.'

item.title: Barnsley appoint former Hannover manager Daniel Stendel as their new boss as they look to emulate Jurgen Klopp's 'Liverpool style' in League One
item.description: Barnsley have appointed former Hannover manager Daniel Stendel as their new head coach on a two-year contract. Stendel, 44, will begin work on July 1 as he looks to guide the club out of League One.
item.content:encoded:
Barnsley have appointed former Hannover manager Daniel Stendel as their new head coach on a two-year contract.

Stendel, 44, will begin work on July 1 as he looks to guide the club out of Sky Bet League One following their relegation from the Championship.

'I am very happy to join Barnsley Football Club and I am happy with the faith, trust and belief shown to me from everyone here in advance of me starting the role,' Stendel told the club's official website.


'I'm fully motivated and excited to get going, I am ready to meet the players and fans during pre-season.'

Barnsley chief executive Gauthier Ganaye believes Stendel will implement the style of play which Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp has helped to popularise.

'We've identified that the counter-press has been used by the most successful teams in the world and Daniel is one of the best coaches at doing that,' Ganaye said.

'The whole board of directors at the club were involved during the process of appointing Daniel in the role of head coach. 

'We identified him as a candidate as he's a coach that has a style of play that matches the mentality of club and town, it's attacking with flair and high intensity designed to press the opposition.

'As well as the style, Daniel has the philosophy of using and developing younger players which fits perfectly in our model too.'

item.title: Ricky Ponting joins Australia coaching staff for ODI and T20 tour of England
item.description: Ponting joins former team mate Justin Langer, who was appointed coach of the team on a four-year term after Darren Lehmann resigned in the wake of a ball-tampering scandal in March.
item.content:encoded:
Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has joined the Australian coaching staff for the side's five one-day internationals and one Twenty20 international game against England in June.

Ponting joins former team mate Justin Langer, who was appointed coach of the team on a four-year term after Darren Lehmann resigned in the wake of a ball-tampering scandal in March.

'Ricky is one of the greats of the game, and since he was already in England doing some commentary we saw it as a great opportunity to have him join our team for this important series,' Langer said in a statement.

Ponting has served as assistant coach for the T20 side twice before, against Sri Lanka in 2017 and for the tri-series against New Zealand and England earlier this year.

He was also head coach of the Delhi Daredevils side in the Indian Premier League this year.


'Ricky's knowledge of the game is second-to-none, and we know that his experiences, tactical expertise and leadership will be invaluable for this group,' Langer added.

The three-times World Cup winner will begin his assignment on June 10, working around his commentary commitments.

item.title: 'He is the best young player in the whole world': Kevin De Bruyne backs Manchester City team mate Leroy Sane after he is left out of the Germany squad for the 2018 World Cup
item.description: De Bruyne has admitted his shock that club team mate Sane has been left out of the Germany squad for the World Cup. The PFA Young Player of the Year is out of Joachim Low's 23-man squad
item.content:encoded:
Kevin De Bruyne has admitted his shock that Manchester City team mate Leroy Sane has been left out of the Germany squad for the 2018 World Cup.

Sane, PFA Young Player of the Year, was surprisingly left out of Joachim Low's 23-man squad for the tournament this summer in Russia.

De Bruyne says the 22-year-old forward is among the very best young players in the world and the tournament will be poorer without him. 

De Bruyne told a press conference: 'I didn't talk with him yet, it just happened, obviously. I just want to give him some space because I don't think he thought he wouldn't be in the squad.

'For me he has been the best young player this year in the whole world, so you can see how I rate him.

'In the end I don't know what happened in Germany, maybe there was an issue between them [Sane and Low]. We'll never know, I guess.'  

Sane was key to City's 100-point Premier League title win last season, with 14 goals and 19 assists in 49 games for Pep Guardiola's team.

He posted a message on Twitter, expressing his disappointment but thanking his supporters for their messages.

Sane wrote: 'Thank you so much everyone for your encouraging messages. I'm obviously disappointed I won't participate in the World Cup, but I have to accept this decision and I'll give it my all to bounce back stronger! Nothing but the best of success to the DFB team in Russia. Go get that title!'

item.title: Australia vow to keep on sledging as they prepare for first international series since ball-tampering scandal
item.description: New captain Tim Paine pledged Australia 'won't be silent' in the five-match One Day International series with England while head coach Justin Langer insisted 'sledging's a good thing'.
item.content:encoded:
Australia have vowed to keep on sledging as they launch their first series since March's ball-tampering scandal.

New captain Tim Paine pledged Australia 'won't be silent' in the five-match One Day International series with England.

Head coach Justin Langer insisted 'sledging's a good thing' - but promised he will not tolerate banter straying into abuse.


'The thing we've spoken about is the difference between abuse and banter,' said new skipper Paine.

'We won't be silent. We're going to be speaking, trying to put pressure on teams as we usually do. But we have to be respectful.

'I'm sure you're going to hear us talking through the stump mic.

'But it's up to me, Justin and the senior players to stay on the side of banter and never go to abuse.

'There's no doubt our reputation took a bit of a battering. That was difficult for the players to come to terms with.

'Coming to England now with new faces, a new coach, just getting back into cricket is an opportunity for us to move on and show we've made a few changes.'

Captain Steve Smith and deputy skipper David Warner were banned for a year over the ball-tampering incident in the third Test against South Africa that shamed Australian cricket.

Cameron Bancroft - who doctored a ball with sandpaper amid South Africa's 322-run win in Cape Town - was also banned for nine months by Cricket Australia.

Head coach Darren Lehmann also paid with his job over the furore, with Langer since installed as his replacement.

Langer promised Australia will not lose their edge despite changes in the wake of March's shameful episode.

He said: 'In Australia sledging's a good thing: if I play Uno with my daughter we sledge each other.

'If I play golf with my parents, we sledged each other. There's a difference between banter and abuse. There's no room for abuse anywhere.

'Even if we were so nice people would think we're a bunch of hard-edged Australians.

'We'll still be called sledging Australians, it's been happening for the last 30 years. So we'll cope with that.'

Former Australia batsman Ricky Ponting has joined Langer's backroom staff for the England trip, as the tourists look to build a new era of more respectful conduct.

Australia will start their tour by facing Sussex at Hove on Thursday, with Langer admitting team bosses have committed a new code of conduct to paper.

But the 47-year-old former Test batsman also conceded Australia must now live up to those bold pronouncements.

'We have our values and our expectations, that's really important,' said Langer.

'We're really clear on certainly as the coach very clear as what our values, behaviours and expectations are.

'But I've said this for 25 years, we can have the fanciest mission statements, but if you don't live them, they're like toilet paper mate. They are written down, but unless you live them they're meaningless.

'Culture is the buzz word at the moment. I remember Jonny Wilkinson getting interviewed by Michael Parkinson. He said without blinking, you are the changing room you walk into.

'We've just got to create the environment where it's a great changing room. All culture is is behaviour. Make it good on and off the field. If we've got good behaviours, then we've got a good environment.'

item.title: 'Maybe one day we'll see each other, have a beer and laugh about it': Nigel De Jong reflects on Xabi Alonso kung-fu tackle during 2010 World Cup final
item.description: Nigel De Jong admits he hopes to one day laugh over a beer with Xabi Alonso when the topic of that tackle in the 2010 World Cup final comes up. De Jong landed a kung-fu style kick on Alonso.
item.content:encoded:
It became one of the most iconic moments of the 2010 World Cup. Nigel De Jong landing a kung-fu kick clean on Xabi Alonso's chest during the final is unlikely to be forgotten.

But the Dutchman, speaking to FourFourTwo, protested his innocence eight years on and hopes a time will come where he and the Spaniard can laugh over it. 

'I just wanted to play the ball – that was my only focus,' the 33-year-old said. 


'I didn't see Alonso coming because he was on my blind side. We've seen each other but we've never spoken about that moment – it's just a moment in football history. 

'Maybe one day we'll see each other, have a beer and laugh about it. Ultimately, he won the game. I think he had the last laugh.' 

The match in Johannesburg ended with Spain winning 1-0 after extra time as Barcelona legend Andres Iniesta got the winning goal.

But more remarkable than the winner was the fact that De Jong remained on the pitch having taken out Alonso in astonishing fashion.

Officiated by English referee Howard Webb, he feels the Englishman aired on the side of leniency - much to his relief. 

'I didn't expect to get sent off at the time because I felt it was obviously an unfortunate incident,' he added.

'I was lucky that an English referee was in charge, because he'd seen many hard challenges in the past. I thought he would give me the benefit of the doubt because I put my hands up immediately.'

item.title: Norman Hunter set to be among FA guests at England v Costa Rica with 1966 World Cup winner and former Leeds player to attend Elland Road
item.description: The now 74-year-old, known as Bites Yer Legs in his playing days, did not feature in the 1966 final against Germany and was only presented with a winners' medal by FIFA in 2007.
item.content:encoded:
World Cup winner Norman Hunter is expected to be among the guests when England play Costa Rica at Elland Road on Thursday night.

Hunter was part of Alf Ramsey's squad for the 1966 triumph and also played for Leeds United during their 1960s and 1970s pomp under Don Revie.

The now 74-year-old, known as Bites Yer Legs in his playing days, did not feature in the 1966 final against Germany and was only presented with a winners' medal in 2007, when FIFA retroactively handed out honours.


Paul Reaney, Allan Clarke and Mick Jones, all former England internationals and members of the same Leeds team, are also anticipated attendees.

The FA will also welcome Danny Mills and Nigel Martyn, who were part of the 2002 World Cup squad.

Thursday night's match is England's first at Leeds's ground since 2002, when they lost 2-1 against Italy. They have played one other match at the stadium, a 3-3 draw against Sweden in the 1995 Umbro Cup.

item.title: Manchester City make fresh £48m bid for Jorginho as they look for quick resolution with Napoli for the Italian
item.description: Manchester City have restructured their offer to Napoli for midfielder Jorginho with a bid now at around £48million. City want a quick resolution to the matter with his price increasing day by day.
item.content:encoded:
Manchester City have restructured their offer to Napoli for midfielder Jorginho with a bid now at around £48million.

City want a quick resolution to the saga for the Italy international, conscious that Napoli are trying raise the price with interest from other clubs.

Jorginho wants to join City but the Premier League champions have made his agent aware they have two other options if an agreement with Napoli is not found soon.


Jorginho's agent Joao Santos said: 'A deadline? Manchester City have one because they look at three names for each position. At the moment they have told me nothing, but I think that Jorginho is their first choice.

Talking to CalcioNapoli24, he added: 'I'm in England, specifically Colchester, 400km from Manchester. The negotiations are in the hands of Napoli, I'm waiting for a signal to understand what to do. This week something will happen. Until Friday I will be in England.' 

City's pursuit of Jorginho hit a snag earlier this week when Napoli president Aurelio De Laurentiis revealed that he turned down their offer of £44m.

He said: 'Jorginho? I have refused an offer from Man City worth €45m (£39m) plus €5m (£4.3m) in bonuses.'

The 26-year-old played a key part in Napoli's title challenge this season, though ultimately the Neopolitan side fell short of Juventus.

Jorginho is highly admired and technically gifted in the centre of the pitch and would give Pep Guardiola another strong option as he plots to win back-to-back league titles.

item.title: Panama celebrate completing heading challenge like they've just beaten England at the World Cup as they prepare for final friendly with Norway
item.description: They are the rank outsiders appearing at their first ever World Cup in Russia this summer. But Panama are determined to make a name for themselves and do their nation proud.
item.content:encoded:
They are the rank outsiders appearing at their first ever World Cup in Russia this summer.

But Panama are determined to make a name for themselves and do their nation proud when they make their debut on the world stage later this month.

And if their exuberance at completing a heading challenge is anything to go by, they will bring plenty of energy and life to the latest festival of football.

Preparing for their final warm-up match against Norway in Oslo on Wednesday, the players took a break to enjoy their chance to showboat in front of the cameras on the touchline.

Veteran forward Blas Perez, 37, exchanged headers with 10 other team-mates before cushioning the final knock-in into a nearby bin to cue bedlam.


Perez wheeled away in celebration to spark jubilant scenes as he was chased by his ecstatic team-mates.

If they're like this after completing a knockabout challenge, what will they be like if they score at the World Cup, or even nick a win over Group G opponents England?

Después de dos horas de un duro entreno previo al partido de mañana y justo antes de recoger los implementos de trabajo, no podíamos irnos sin disfrutar JUNTOS de este cierre del día, 😎juventud y experiencia Camino a Rusia

A post shared by Blas Pérez 🇵🇦 (@elraton7) on Jun 5, 2018 at 12:59pm PDT

PANAMA FIXTURES 

June 18: Belgium, Sochi, 4pm

June 24: England, Novgorod, 1pm

June 28: Tunisia, Saransk, 7pm

Perez wrote next to the video on Instagram: 'After two hours of hard training prior to tomorrow's match and just before picking up the work tools, we could not leave without enjoying TOGETHER of this close of the day.

'"Youth and experience", Road to Russia'.

Panama begin their tournament against Belgium on June 18 before facing England on June 24.

The Central Americans will hope to still have everything to play for by the time they face fellow outsiders Tunisia on June 28.

item.title: How will £52m Brazilian star Fred fit in at Man United? Can he turbo-charge their sluggish play and will he help get the best out of Paul Pogba?
item.description: Manchester United have wasted little time making Fred their first signing of the summer? But is he the man to speed up Jose Mourinho's often sluggish side and can he liberate Paul Pogba?
item.content:encoded:
Manchester United have wasted little time in making their first signing of the summer, bringing in the Brazilian midfielder Fred from Shakhtar Donetsk for £52million.

Having completed his medical and agreed a five-year deal with the Old Trafford club, Fred is expected to be officially unveiled as a United player at some point soon.

But what type of player is Fred and how is he going to fit into Jose Mourinho's plans next season? Can he help United raise their game above the often sluggish and monotonous performances of last season?


 

Where does Fred play and what type of player is he?

Asked to describe his manner of playing a couple of years ago, Fred put it rather nicely: 'I am a conductor.'

Well, the United orchestra has been out of tune for some time under Mourinho and they'll hope and pray Fred is the midfield virtuoso that can get them back on song next season.

He is commonly described as a box-to-box midfielder, a dynamic player who offers both defensive and offensive attributes, a disruptor and a creator rolled into one.

Mourinho has signed a versatile asset - Fred was originally a left back before being converted into midfield when he signed for Internacional in his homeland in 2011.

Because he is comfortable on both feet, Fred had been deployed as an attacking midfielder at times during his career before settling into a central or deeper midfield role.

The most important thing for United is that he is quick to spark attacks by carrying the ball from defence and feeding the attacking players.

They have been crying out for something like this for a while - all too often last season United were sluggish breaking forward, allowing opponents to track back and regroup.

Fred's speed of both feet and thought, plus his passing range, should help United be speedier in their transitions from front to back next season.

What are Fred's strengths?

We've already mentioned versatility, speed in transition and passing capability with both feet.

Naturally as a Brazilian, he boasts plenty of technical ability and can beat an opponent on the dribble, while another key attribute is that Fred possesses plenty of stamina to fulfil the box-to-box job.

Mourinho will also be satisfied that Fred can put in a defensive shift if United find themselves under the cosh.

At Shakhtar, he earned the trust of coach Paulo Fonseca, who allowed him to freely perform both the defensive and offensive duties of a midfielder.

It remains to be seen if Mourinho, who often puts the tactical straitjacket on his players, will give him such liberty.

Funnily enough, Fred revealed in 2016 that his role model was compatriot Fernandinho, who will of course play across town at Manchester City next season.

But actually a better comparison might be with Chelsea's N'Golo Kante in terms of that box-to-box stamina, adaptability and dynamism. If he turns out to be a Kante, United fans will be pretty chuffed.

And what about his weaknesses?

He only stands 5ft 7in tall, so don't expect Fred to be winning too many headers.

But he more than makes up for that in terms of tenacity - he was Shakhtar's most prolific tackler in the Champions League last season with an average of 2.9 per game (Kante's average was 3.3).

However, United should be wary that this tenacity can sometimes spill over into ill-discipline. He received 14 yellow cards and one red in 29 games for the Ukrainian side last season.

The other concern is that while Fred has played 39 European matches for Shakhtar, the Ukrainian Premier League isn't exactly at the same standard of the Premier League.

United fans may have to be patient while the Brazilian gets up to speed next season, especially as he'll probably be entering the campaign off the back of a lengthy run at the World Cup in Russia.

How will he fit into a 4-3-3 system at United?

Mourinho went with a 4-3-3 formation in a good number of United's matches last season and this would appear to be the best solution when it comes to accommodating both Fred and Paul Pogba in the midfield.

He would play either in the middle or on the right of the midfield three alongside Nemanja Matic, with Pogba stationed on the left.

Some of Pogba's best performances for United have come from this left-sided station and potentially Fred could offer the answer when it comes to belatedly getting the best out of the Frenchman at United.

The key is in the link-up and transition between the deep-lying Matic and the rampaging Pogba, plus a forward line of Jesse Lingard, Alexis Sanchez and Romelu Lukaku further on.

There should be a good balance about United's midfield with Fred aiding Matic in the defensive responsibilities when required and then springing Pogba.

The idea is that the speed of these transitions will give United the thrust going forward they have so often lacked under Mourinho.

How will he fit into a 4-2-3-1 system at United?

In certain games, Mourinho will revert to the tried and trusted 4-2-3-1, with Fred likely to sit in alongside Matic in defensive midfield.

This would be a more conservative role, with opportunities to break forward more limited, but Fred is certainly capable of the tactical discipline Mourinho would want with this set-up.

One of the chief criticisms of Pogba - and a reason why the youngster Scott McTominay was drafted in for big games last season - was that he lacked this discipline and would over-complicate things.

Problem is, it's now hard to see how they all could be accommodated in this formation and Pogba could well be seeing more of the United bench.

Reason being that United have so many decent attacking options Pogba wouldn't slot in.

Who is going to make way?

In the 4-3-3, the man who looks like he has the most to lose is Ander Herrera. 

The Spaniard was drafted in to try to solve the Pogba conundrum but, though his passing is excellent, he struggles in the midfield battle.

Fred has a far greater dynamism in this regard - he's also quicker, more skilful, more tenacious and more attack-minded - so you have to fear for Herrera.

Mind you, given the sheer volume of matches United will have to get through domestically and in the Champions League next season, plus the inevitable injuries and suspensions, Herrera will no doubt still feature at times.

Is Fred the man to get the best out of Pogba?

Having spent two seasons trying to figure out the Pogba equation, Mourinho will certainly hope that is the case.

As explained, Fred should have the attributes to fit in as the link-man between Matic and Pogba, theoretically allowing the £89m man to forget defensive duties and concentrate on aiding United's attack.

It may take a few matches, a few months even, for Fred and Pogba to get used to playing alongside one another. They may well thread on each other's toes at first.

What Mourinho should have here is the ideal man to bring the best out of Pogba in an attacking sense. If that doesn't happen, then United may have to cut their losses.

Who else are United likely to sign?

Mourinho's second signing of the summer looks likely to be the 19-year-old Porto defender Diogo Dalot.

Dalot completed his United medical after they triggered the £17.4m release clause in his contract and the deal should be completed this week.

That may not be the last defensive addition, however, with Mourinho in the market for a top class centre-half such as Tottenham's Toby Alderweireld or Clement Lenglet of Sevilla.

Then there is the tantalising possibility of a megabucks move for Gareth Bale, who couldn't have made it clearer after the Champions League final that he wants to leave Real Madrid.

It would cost United upwards of £85m to sign the Welsh star but he would certainly bring some X-factor to United's forward line if partnered with Lukaku and Sanchez.

Having completed his medical and agreed a five-year deal with the Old Trafford club, Fred is expected to be officially unveiled as a United player at some point soon. But what type of player is Fred and how is he going to fit into Jose Mourinho's plans next season? Can he help United raise their game above the often sluggish and monotonous performances of last season?

item.title: Crystal Palace 'eye £12m-rated Hiroki Sakai' as AC Milan and Napoli also keep tabs on Marseille and Japan ace
item.description: He would be the eighth Japanese player to feature in the Premier League — after Junichi Inamot, Shinji Kagawa, Ryo Miyaichi, Hidetoshi Nakata, Shinji Okazaki, Kazuyuki Toda and Maya Yoshida.
item.content:encoded:
Crystal Palace are reportedly keen to sign Japan international Hiroki Sakai from Marseille.

The 28-year-old right back, who is heading to the World Cup in Russia, is under contract at Marseille until 2021.

But according to the London Evening Standard, £12million-rated Sakai is a target for multiple clubs, including Palace, Sevilla, AC Milan, Inter Milan and Napoli.


Brighton and Leicester are also said to have checked in on the former Kashiwa Reysol and Hannover 96 man, although his valuation could put them off.

Palace manager Roy Hodgson are in the market for a new right-sided defender as Joel Ward is expected to move on this summer when his contract expires.

Ryan Fredericks had been a top target but West Ham beat Palace to the punch when they landed the 25-year-old on a four-year deal from Fulham this week.

Signing Sakai would likely boost Palace's popularity in Asia.

He would be the eighth Japanese player to feature in the Premier League — after Junichi Inamot, Shinji Kagawa, Ryo Miyaichi, Hidetoshi Nakata, Shinji Okazaki, Kazuyuki Toda and Maya Yoshida.

item.title: Billy Joe Saunders closes in on London superfight with Gennady Golovkin following collapse of Kazakh's rematch with Canelo Alvarez
item.description: Golovkin, the WBC, WBA, IBF and IBO champion, has long coveted Saunders title, which would complete his set. The Kazakh puncher would have no qualms about returning to London.
item.content:encoded:
Billy Joe Saunders is closing on a London superfight with Gennady Golovkin following the apparent collapse of Triple G's rematch with Canelo Alvarez.

Canelo's Golden Boy promoter Oscar De La Hoya has announced the opening of negotiations for Daniel Jacobs to replace Golovkin in Las Vegas on September 15.

That clears the way for a world middleweight title unification fight between Golovkin and Saunders, who had withdrawn injured from this month's defence of his WBO belt against Martin Murray.


Golovkin, the WBC, WBA, IBF and IBO champion, has long coveted Saunders title, which would complete his set. The Kazakh puncher would have no qualms about returning to London, where he knocked out Kell Brook.

The only complication is the pressure on Golovkin to fulfill a mandatory defence of his IBF title. But Saunders in the UK offers a much bigger pay day.

Billy Joe's potential good fortune comes with disappointment for the world boxing audience who have been itching for a repeat of the controversial first fight between Canelo and Triple G.

But De La Hoya has told ESPN: 'The Canelo train has left the station.' That comes after months of haggling over the purse split since the May postponement of the rematch after Alvarez was briefly suspended for two positive drugs tests in February.

Golovkin has been demanding compensation by way of an improvement in his mega millions percentage from 65-35 to 50-50. 

'No way that's happening,' says De La Hoya.

Not that negotiations will be a cake walk for Jacobs, who is the first big name signed by Anthony Joshua promoter Eddie Hearn for his new US stable.

Hearn is also deep in talks for AJ to meet America's WBC world heavyweight champion in a huge title unification fight.

Nor will fighting Jacobs mollify the millions of fans suspecting that Canelo is ducking a rematch with Golovkin who was robbed of victory by the Vegas judges in their first fight.

The London Stadium is a possible venue for Saunders v Golovkin. Perhaps as early as August. 

Frank Warren, promoter of Saunders, is taking nothing for granted. He says: 'The Canelo and Golovkin teams may still be playing hard ball with each other.

'That fight could still happen. Although Billy Joe would love to fight Triple G and believes he could win.'

item.title: Lando Norris denied the chance to become youngest British Formula One driver in history as McLaren reject approach from Toro Rosso
item.description: Teenager Lando Norris has been offered – and denied – a chance to become the youngest British Formula One driver in history. The 18-year-old is currently the reserve driver for McLaren.
item.content:encoded:
Teenager Lando Norris has been offered – and denied – a chance to become the youngest British Formula One driver in history.

The 18-year-old was approached by Red Bull’s junior team Toro Rosso to race in one of their cars for the remainder of the season, only for his employers McLaren to say no.

Sportsmail understands that Toro Rosso were keen to extend Norris’s proposed debut half-season into a longer-term deal with them.  


This was unacceptable to McLaren, who rate Norris – their current test driver – as a jewel for the future. 

A McLaren spokesman said: ‘We are not surprised that other teams approach our drivers. They clearly believe they are as talented as we do.’

Norris has been compared with a young Lewis Hamilton, another prodigy schooled in McLaren’s young driver programme before being unleashed on the 2007 Formula One season.

Norris could be given his chance next season at McLaren – as a replacement for 36-year-old Fernando Alonso if he quits, or for Belgian Stoffel Vandoorne. 

A more cautionary alternative would be to place him in a less glamorous team to gain experience before being given his big break at McLaren in 2020.

It is believed Norris would have replaced New Zealander Brendon Hartley from next month’s Austrian Grand Prix onwards had Toro Rosso got their way.

Norris, from Glastonbury in Somerset, won last year’s Formula Three series and currently holds a 27-point lead in Formula Two, F1’s feeder series. He is managed by McLaren chief executive Zak Brown.

item.title: MCC unveil new designs for Compton and Edrich Stands at Lord's to increase capacity by 2,500 seats
item.description: The proposals will accommodate 11,500 at the Nursery End and will take place over a two-year period between 2019 and 2021, with a walkway linking both stands through the Media Centre.
item.content:encoded:
The MCC have released the new designs for the latest phase in their redevelopment of Lord's.

The new three-tier Compton and Edrich Stands will boost capacity at the home of cricket by 2,500 seats, taking the ground to an overall 32,500-seater.

The proposals will accommodate 11,500 at the Nursery End and will take place over a two-year period between 2019 and 2021, with a walkway linking both stands underneath the Media Centre.

Work will commence after next year's Test match against Australia, following the Cricket World Cup, with Lord's hosting the final on July 15.

MCC members will be asked to approve the plan at next year's AGM. 


Seats in the new stands will be in place by the 2020 season, with completion due on the reconstruction work the following summer. The total cost is expected to be in the region of £50m.

The proposals form the next part of the phased Masterplan for Lord's. Last year, the new £25 million Warner Stand was opened, the first stand to be rebuilt at Lord's since 1997.

MCC Chief Executive and Secretary Guy Lavender said: 'MCC is committed to ensuring Lord's remains the best place in the world at which to watch and play cricket. 

'These new stands will transform the Nursery End, providing world-class facilities, opening up views both to the Pavilion and back towards the Nursery Ground, and adding another architectural enhancement to Lord's.

'We are very aware of the responsibility we have to protect everything that makes Lord's so special, and we are delighted with the positive feedback we've already received from our membership.

'As well as providing a significant improvement to capacity and facilities, the plans for the new Compton and Edrich stands complement beautifully the J.P. Morgan Media Centre, which was designed by Future Systems and is itself an award-winning building, well known to anyone who has watched cricket at Lord's.'

item.title: Chelsea's stand-off with Antonio Conte set to scupper transfer plans as targets remain reluctant to join during managerial uncertainty
item.description: The Blues cannot fully press ahead with plans for next season until they know who will be in charge, with Maurizio Sarri currently the club’s top target and Laurent Blanc another contender.
item.content:encoded:
Chelsea risk hindering their chances of building a Premier League title-challenging team for next season the longer their stand-off with Antonio Conte continues.

The Blues cannot fully press ahead with plans until they know who will be in charge, with Maurizio Sarri currently the top target and Laurent Blanc another contender.

Potential summer signings also want to know who will be their boss at Stamford Bridge next season, putting Chelsea at risk of falling behind on their rivals.


While others are already getting down to business, such as Jose Mourinho’s Manchester United, there has been a slow start to the summer from Chelsea.

Almost three weeks on from their FA Cup win, Conte remains in charge at Chelsea but the Italian is still set to be sacked once a replacement is confirmed.

The squad know they will likely have a new manager to work with next season and Conte may not receive too many thanks from his players on social media.

The former Italy boss has fallen out with several stars, including Diego Costa, the popular Premier League winner who left for Atletico Madrid.

Conte has emerged as a leading candidate at Real Madrid as he remains the only manager with a recent proven track record who is likely to be available this summer.

Massimiliano Allegri’s reluctance to take the Bernabeu job has turned the troubled European champions towards Conte.

Real want to buy a goalkeeper, pursue the signature of Neymar, off-load Ronaldo and were not willing to give Zinedine Zidane full powers in the transfer market.

Conte has complained of being in a similar situation at Chelsea on occasions and his abrasive attitude had made him someone the club did not immediately consider when they drew up their first post-Zidane shortlist.

But with Mauricio Pochettino and Jurgen Klopp wedded to their current clubs and tied to long contracts Madrid started to widen the net.

item.title: England train ahead of final World Cup warm-up game against Costa Rica as countdown to Russia continues
item.description: England host Costa Rica at Elland Road in Leeds on Thursday night as the countdown to the World Cup continues. A fully-fit squad trained at St George's Park on Wednesday.
item.content:encoded:
Gareth Southgate's England squad trained on Wednesday in preparation for their final World Cup warm-up game.

England host Costa Rica at Elland Road in Leeds on Thursday night as the countdown to the World Cup continues. 

A fully-fit squad trained at St George's Park including three stand-by players.


Tom Heaton, Jake Livermore and Adam Lallana took part in the session.

Fellow stand-by man Lewis Cook is currently with the England Under 21s for the Toulon Tournament with the Young Lions facing Scotland in the semi-finals on Wednesday.

Southgate will hold a press conference later on Thursday once the squad have arrived in Leeds.

England beat Nigeria 2-1 last Saturday in their other friendly prior to their trip to Russia.

Southgate's side kick-off their World Cup campaign against Tunisia on June 18.

They then face Panama in Group G on June 24 before taking on Belgium in their final group game on June 28. 

ENGLAND'S GROUP G FIXTURES

vs Tunisia: Monday, June 18 (Volgograd Arena, 7pm)

vs Panama: Sunday, June 24 (Nizhny Novgorod Stadium, 1pm)

vs Belgium: Thursday, June 28 (Kaliningrad Stadium, 7pm)

item.title: Aston Villa Q&A: 90 minutes from the Premier League, now on the brink of administration... what's gone wrong?
item.description: Football has not seen too many falls as spectacular as Villa’s following their Championship play-off final less than two weeks ago at Wembley. Here, Sportsmail takes a look at the serious issues...
item.content:encoded:
Football has not seen too many falls off cliffs as spectacular as Aston Villa’s following their Championship play-off final less than two weeks ago at Wembley.

Steve Bruce’s side have gone from being 90 minutes from Premier League promotion to staring into the abyss of administration, unsure of what will happen next.

Here, Sportsmail takes a look at the serious issues which are mounting for Villa and answers your questions on the worrying situation.

What’s gone wrong?

Villa are facing administration because of serious financial issues, which makes their loss to 10-man Fulham in the final all the more miserable.

Promotion to the Premier League is worth around £170million and it appears Villa were banking on that when they started paying out significant wages at the start of this season.

John Terry, for example, was earning £60,000 a week – a steep salary in the Championship and one they can no longer afford. Villa were also paying £42,000 of Robert Snodgrass’ £60,000 during his season-long loan from West Ham.

Now, Villa must raise around £40m to avoid being found in breach of the Football League’s Financial Fair Play rules.

What was Tuesday’s fall-out all about?

Keith Wyness, the chief executive, was suspended on Tuesday after Villa failed to pay a late tax bill just shy of £5m to HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC).

As Sportsmail’s Laurie Whitwell told us, it is believed Villa had been given until last Friday to settle the overdue sum but missed the date and were threatened with a winding-up order.

Villa claim it will be resolved soon with an initial payment of £2m, but owner and chairman Tony Xia has been accused of failing to put cash into the club for three months.

Xia, who has no financial issues himself with an estimated fortune of £1billion, is said to have been struggling to get money out of China following a government clampdown.


Where is Xia and was it his call to suspend Wyness?

Xia has been in China since Villa’s play-off final defeat 10 days ago and he is said to have suspended Wyness after the two had a disagreement.

According to some, Xia was unhappy with Wyness advising they settle their hefty tax bill owed to HMRC. There is no suggestion that Wyness has been accused of wrongdoing but Xia has now announced he will take over as chief executive until further notice.

In an alternative version of events it has been claimed Wyness was attempting to bring together a consortium to buy the club without Xia's knowledge, who then found out and acted.

Is there a solution?

There could be. What happens next may depend on the valuations of Xia. There is understood to be interest from Peter B Freund, a shareholder in baseball’s New York Yankees, in buying Villa for £75m.

These days, that kind of cash signs you a striker for a top-four Premier League club. Will Xia accept that? The Chinese businessman is believed to have valued Villa at £100m initially.

However, given the severity of their financial woes and issues with the HMRC, he could lower it. He may struggle to get a full £100m, given their threat of administration.

How does this have an influence on the actual team?

This has led to uncertainty over players’ futures. Terry, their captain of last season, is not set to re-sign when his one-year contract officially expires at the end of this month. West Ham’s Snodgrass is the same.

Meanwhile, we are already deep into the summer window and signings are no doubt down the list of priorities at Villa.

Plus, to find those £40m of savings to adhere to FFP regulations, Jack Grealish could be sold. Villa would want around £30m for him alone, as well as £10m for James Chester.

Villa are set for a reduced final year of parachute payments worth around £16m next season. That does not help you out a lot these days.

And the manager?

Bruce has still not been told by the club that they want him to continue and is said to be considering his future. The now-suspended Wyness was among his allies.

Also, without investment, it is unlikely Bruce will be able to push for promotion with Villa again next season, particularly as he loses the influence of Terry and potentially Grealish.

He is believed to be open to staying but does Bruce have the backing of the board? No-one knows yet, not even him apparently.

And Xia has stayed silent throughout this?

He is something of a maverick on social media. His last update on Twitter came three days after the defeat by Fulham.

It read: ‘Still hurting. Felt even more when you realise how much all ppl love the club, gaffer, the whole squad, including myself, have given everything but still didn’t achieve our target. Also very difficult to verify ppl showing their real personality and humanity at this tough moment.’

What have the club said amid all this chaos?

Villa released a statement on Tuesday but only addressed the Wyness news, not whether they were looking for a buyer.

‘Aston Villa Football Club can confirm that chief executive, Keith Wyness, has been suspended by the club with immediate effect,’ it said.

‘Owner and chairman, Dr Tony Xia will assume the role until further notice. There will be no further comment from the club at this time.’

There will be a lot of work going on behind the scenes. Villa have found themselves pushed into a corner and have to fight hard to get out.

item.title: Liverpool keen to land £10m rated Moses Simon as Jurgen Klopp looks to add depth to his attacking options
item.description: Moses Simon has one year left on his Gent contract and is expected to command a fee of around £10million. He would be seen as back-up to Mohamed Salah and Sadio Mane at Anfield.
item.content:encoded:
Liverpool are keen to sign Nigerian winger Moses Simon as Jurgen Klopp looks to add depth to his attacking options this summer.

Simon, who is wanted by several Premier League clubs, has a year left remaining on his current contract at Belgian side Gent.

According to the Liverpool Echo, the 22-year-old is expected to cost in the region of £10million and would be seen as back-up to Mohamed Salah and Sadio Mane.


Simon is versatile and can play on either flank but was primarily used on the left by Gent last season.

He scored six goals and added a further three assists to help his team to a fourth-place finish in the Belgian league. 

Simon will not be representing his country at this summer's World Cup after being overlooked for a place in Nigeria's final 23-man squad by Gernot Rohr.

Jurgen Klopp has already strengthened the squad that finished fourth in the Premier League and lost in the Champions League final.

Naby Keita will join this summer from RB Leipzig while Brazilian midfielder Fabinho became the club's first signing of the window last month and will arrive from Monaco.

A goalkeeper also remains a priority for the Reds while their interest in France and Lyon attacker Nabil Fekir is still very much alive.

item.title: Rafael Marquez trains in special kit with no sponsor logos as US freeze his assets over drug trafficking allegations
item.description: Look at pictures of Mexico training for the World Cup, and at first glance there doesn't appear to be anything amiss - it's a squad like the other 31 teams, preparing for the tournament.
item.content:encoded:
Look at pictures of Mexico training for the World Cup, and at first glance there doesn't appear to be anything amiss - it's a squad like the other 31, preparing for the tournament.

However, there is something unusual, and that is the kit of veteran defender Rafael Marquez, the 39-year-old former Barcelona player, for who Russia 2018 will be his fifth World Cup. 

While the other Mexico strips are plastered with the usual array of sponsors, Marquez has to train in a specially designed, plain black top.


This is because Marquez is facing sanctions from the United States Treasury for alleged ties to drug trafficking. Marquez denied any involvement - but, unsurprisingly, many of Mexico's sponsors are not keen to be connected with him. 

The US government are able to freeze any American assets belonging to Marquez, who played in the MLS for two years with New York Red Bulls between 2010 and 2012.

Known as the 'Kingpin Act', this also prevents any American organisations doing business with him. As the Mexico team is sponsored by US brands such as Coca Cola and Citibank, it is hardly surprising that Marquez's chest is a sponsor-free zone.

The accusations began last August, when Marquez appeared on a list of 21 Mexicans accused of assisting Raul Flores Hernandez, aka drugs lord El Senor. 

Marquez is accused of being a 'front' - laundering El Senor's money through nine legitimate businesses, including the charity named after the footballer.

He has denied every charge: 'In the same way I have done throughout my professional career I will confront this, my most difficult match', he said last year. 

Despite all this, Marquez will travel to Russia as part of the 23-man Mexican squad, and retains the support of the national FA and the manager, Juan Carlos Osorio.

A statement released last week said: 'In order that Rafa Marquez can be 100 per cent focused on sport and knowing the personal issues that he is going through, we have consulted with different experts and decided to take actions that, as we understand, won't harm or involve actions that could damage Rafa Marquez or the Mexican Football Federation (FMF).' 

These actions, it transpires, are to have Marquez train for Mexico without wearing any of the national sponsors. 

Marquez remains a national hero - when they were given their official send-off before the tournament, he shook hands and laughed with Mexican president Enrique Pena Nieto.

When Pena Nieto showed off a special commemorative shirt with his name on the back, Marquez was sat in the front row directly behind him.

Whether the 39-year-old can be a major influence for Mexico in Russia, where they face a tough group alongside Germany, Sweden and South Korea, remains to be seen. What happens after that is even more uncertain.

item.title: 'The patient next to me was diagnosed with cancer... what's up with my knee is nothing': Benjamin Mendy reveals how he put injury woes into context during time in hospital last season
item.description: Manchester City and France left back Benjamin Mendy has opened up about how a cancer patient in the hospital bed next to him in Barcelona gave him perspective during his time out injured.
item.content:encoded:
Manchester City and France left back Benjamin Mendy has opened up about how a cancer patient in the hospital bed next to him in Barcelona gave him perspective during his time out injured.

The 23-year-old ruptured his right knee ligaments against Crystal Palace in September 2017 and only returned to action in the remaining games in a bid to prove his fitness for the World Cup.

Mendy earned a place in Didier Deschamps' 23-man squad and speaking to SFR Sport, the Frenchman explains how he quickly realised his injury worries paled in significance to those around him in the hospital. 


'When I was in Barcelona, the patient next to me, a Spaniard, was diagnosed with cancer,' he said.

'We found out two days later. He was dying. I told myself: "What's up with my knee, it's nothing". I think that helped with my recovery.

'When you've hurt your knee or your ligaments, it's nothing at all compared to folk who suffer things that are far more serious.'

Mendy marked his return to action for Pep Guardiola's side in late April at home against Swansea, when he was introduced from the bench.  

Mendy is known as one of football's best characters and he has kept spirits high among an optimistic young French squad this summer.

Deschamps side begin their group against Australia on June 16 before facing Peru and Denmark ahead of the knockout stages.

item.title: Usain Bolt features for Stromsgodset against Norway U19s as sprint legend gets ready to play in Soccer Aid
item.description: Usain Bolt has proven himself as a world class sprinter but the evidence suggests that he has some improvements to make on the football pitch.
item.content:encoded:
Usain Bolt has proven himself as a world class sprinter but the evidence suggests that he has some improvements to make on the football pitch.

Bolt is currently preparing to take part in this year's Soccer Aid game, which is being held at Old Trafford on Sunday.

The sprinting legend has been training with Stromsgodset and received a runout in a game against Norway U19s.


Bolt had the number 9.58 on his back, relating to the 100 metre world record that he set in 2009.

Eager to make an impact, Bolt was introduced as a substitute against Norway U19s but he didn't seem especially sharp.

On one occasion Bolt missed an inviting opportunity to score with a header, while he also lost the ball several times.

The 31-year-old wasn't presented with many opportunities to use his speed, but he will hope to make a bigger impact during Soccer Aid, when he will be featuring for the World XI alongside the likes of Yaya Toure, Kevin Pietersen and Gordon Ramsay.

Their opponents Team England, meanwhile, will be able to call upon Michael Owen, Olly Murs and Mo Farah.

Bolt later posted a picture of himself alongside other Soccer Aid participants including Robert Pires.

Having retired from athletics in 2017, Bolt has frequently spoken of his passion for football.

He has previously trained with Borussia Dortmund as well as South African team Mamelodi Sundowns.

item.content:encoded:
Stoke City are prepared to pay nearly £30million to pair Benik Afobe and Andre Gray in a new look strikeforce.

Wolves triggered their option to buy Afobe last week and will make a quick profit with Stoke prepared to pay more than other Championship rivals.

Watford are prepared to listen to offers for Gray, who cost them £18m from Burnley last year. 


The striker has been frustrated at his lack of starting opportunities but may wait to see what other interest there is before committing to Stoke despite their clear ambition to go straight back up at the first attempt.

Stoke have opened talks with Joe Allen over a new contract while West Ham have shown an interest in defender Ryan Shawcross.

The Potters were relegated from the Premier League at the end of last season and have a new manager in Gary Rowett.

item.title: Real Madrid set to swoop for Chelsea boss Antonio Conte after Massimiliano Allegri knocks them back
item.description: Massimiliano Allegri’s reluctance to take the Real Madrid job has turned the troubled European champions towards another Italian coach – Antonio Conte.
item.content:encoded:
Massimiliano Allegri’s reluctance to take the Real Madrid job has turned the troubled European champions towards another Italian coach – Antonio Conte.

The Chelsea boss is emerging as the only manager with a recent proven track record who is likely to be available this summer.

Thursday will mark one week without a manager since Zinedine Zidane left Madrid after disagreeing with the board over plans for next season.


Real want to buy a goalkeeper, pursue the signature of Neymar, offload Ronaldo and were not willing to give Zidane full power in the transfer market.

Conte has complained of being in a similar situation at Chelsea on occasions and his abrasive attitude had made him someone the club did not immediately consider when they drew up their first post-Zidane shortlist.

But with Mauricio Pochettino and Jurgen Klopp wedded to their current clubs and tied to long contracts, Madrid started to widen the net.

Spanish media have claimed Allegri had been offered the job but turned it down. That has seen the Conte option gain ground.

Madrid have host of quick alternatives available to them. Arsene Wenger, Guti, Michel and Michael Laudrup could all be recruited with no need for compensation or lengthy negotiations.

But the board are not satisfied that any of them would be popular or successful appointments.

Further evidence of a rift between Real Madrid and Zidane has emerged with the suggestion that the French coach wanted to begin next pre-season with two weeks training in Madrid before the summer tour. But the club were insisting the team be taken on the scheduled North American trip and begin pre-season there.

item.title: Lionel Messi returns to Barcelona stomping ground as Argentina gear up for World Cup after friendly with Israel is cancelled due to political protests
item.description: Lionel Messi returned to his home away from home as Argentina make their final preparations for the World Cup at Barcelona's training ground on Wednesday morning.
item.content:encoded:
Lionel Messi returned to his home away from home as Argentina make their final preparations for the World Cup at Barcelona's training ground on Wednesday morning.

Jorge Sampaoli's side took part in a training session at the Ciutat Esportiva Joan Gamper, home of the famous La Masia, in a bid to keep fresh for the tournament in Russia in under a fortnight's time.

Argentina will now have a 10-day break before their next match, which will be their first group game against Iceland on June 16, after their final friendly before flying out to Moscow was cancelled due to widespread protests.


Their friendly with Israel was cancelled as political pressure grew ahead of Saturday's scheduled fixture in Jerusalem.

'They've finally done the right thing,' Higuain told ESPN, confirming reports the game had been cancelled.

There was no initial reaction from the Israeli FA or from Israeli politicians as reports said that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called Argentinian President Mauricio Macri to ask him to persuade the team not to cancel their visit.

Israel Radio quoted an unnamed diplomatic official who said the chances of salvaging the fixture were very slim. 

The visit of Argentina attracted huge interest among Israeli fans, mainly due to anticipation surrounding Messi's presence in Jerusalem. 

Palestinians celebrated the cancellation as the Palestinian FA issued a statement that read: 'We thank Argentina's players led by star Messi for refusing to be used to serve a non-sporting goal.'

The match was originally to be played in Haifa but Israeli authorities contributed funding for it to be moved to Jerusalem, irking Palestinians further following US President Donald Trump's recognition of the city as Israel's capital. The US embassy was moved there last month. 

The game will have helped Sampaoli with his preparations going into the tournament but will now stay in Catalonia until they depart for Russia next week. 

The two-time World Cup winners face Iceland, Nigeria and Croatia in what is considered to be one of the hardest groups in the tournament.
